home.title: Breast Cancer Early Screening System
home.subtitle: AI-powered breast cancer early screening and risk assessment platform for women's health
home.dataUploadDesc: Support for medical reports (TXT/PDF) and breast imaging (PNG/DICOM) upload
home.riskPredictionDesc: AI intelligent analysis, outputs risk level and probability within 10 seconds
home.personalizedAdviceDesc: Generate customized screening recommendations based on age and risk level
home.healthEducationDesc: Breast cancer early symptoms, screening frequency and other health knowledge
home.startJourneyDesc: Upload your medical reports or imaging data to get professional AI risk assessment and personalized recommendations

upload.title: Data Upload
upload.dragText: Drag files here or click to upload
upload.supportedFormats: Supported formats: TXT, PDF, PNG, JPG, DICOM
upload.reportDesc: Support for plain text and PDF format medical reports, system will automatically extract key indicators
upload.imageDesc: Support for common image formats and DICOM medical imaging standards
upload.instruction1: • System will automatically identify file types
upload.instruction4: • Risk assessment available after processing completion
upload.note1: • Single file size should not exceed 50MB
upload.note2: • Support batch upload of multiple files

prediction.title: Risk Prediction Analysis
prediction.startAnalysisDesc: Click the button below to start AI intelligent analysis, system will complete risk assessment within 10 seconds
prediction.disclaimerText: This analysis is for reference only and cannot replace professional medical diagnosis. If you have any abnormal symptoms, please seek medical attention promptly. Regular professional screening is recommended. Maintain a healthy lifestyle.

advice.title: Personalized Advice
advice.hasFamilyHistory: Do you have a family history of breast cancer
advice.getAdviceDesc: Please fill in the form on the left, the system will generate personalized screening recommendations and health guidance based on your personal information
advice.reminderText: The above recommendations are generated based on the information you provided and are for reference only. If you have any abnormal symptoms or concerns, please consult a professional doctor promptly.

education.title: Health Education
education.breastLumpDesc: Painless lump in the breast, hard texture, unclear boundaries
education.nippleDischargeDesc: Bloody, serous or purulent discharge during non-lactation period
education.skinChangesDesc: Skin appears depressed, orange peel-like changes or ulcers
education.nippleRetractionDesc: Sudden nipple retraction or position change
education.breastPainDesc: Persistent breast pain, unrelated to menstrual cycle
education.lymphNodeDesc: Painless lymph node enlargement in the armpit
education.reminderText: If any of the above symptoms occur, please seek medical attention promptly for professional examination. Early detection and treatment are key to improving cure rates.
education.screeningAdviceText: It is recommended to start monthly breast self-examination from age 20, and annual mammography from age 40. People with family history or other high-risk factors should consult a doctor to develop personalized screening plans.
education.examTimeDesc: Recommended 3-7 days after menstruation ends, postmenopausal women can choose a fixed date each month
education.step1: 1. Stand in front of a mirror and observe if there are any changes in breast appearance
education.step2: 2. Raise your arms and check breasts and armpits
education.step3: 3. Lie flat and gently press with fingertips to check the entire breast
education.step4: 4. Check if there is any nipple discharge
education.note3: • Pay attention to any abnormal changes
education.note4: • Seek medical attention promptly if in doubt

footer.description: AI-powered breast cancer early screening and risk assessment platform
footer.copyright: Breast Cancer Early Screening System. All rights reserved.
footer.disclaimer: This system is for health education and reference only and cannot replace professional medical diagnosis. If you have any health problems, please consult a professional doctor promptly.
